Name: Statue of Sheikh el-Balad
Description: This fine example of wooden statuary shows Sheikh el-Balad as a young man with a tall slim body, simply and elegantly sculptured. It was originally plastered and painted. Although the inlaid eyes, the serious mouth and rather haughty bearing, the portrait looks like a very lively character. This statue was found at Saqqara. It was suggested that this statue also came from the tomb of Ka aper and depicted him in his youth.
